Title: $n+1$ is a divisor of $\binom{2n} {n}$
Content: I want to show that $n+1$ is a divisor of $\displaystyle\binom{2n} {n}$ , $\forall n\in\mathbb{N}.$ I have tried to show it by induction and Pascal's rule but it did not work. I would appreciate some help.
AcceptedAnswer:
From the Wikipedia page for Catalan numbers: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalan_number Note that $$\binom {2n}{n+1} = \frac{(2n)!}{(n-1)!(n+1)!} = \frac{n}{n+1} \frac{(2n)!}{n!n!} = \frac{n}{n+1}\binom{2n}{n}$$ So $$\frac{1}{n+1}\binom{2n}{n} = \binom{2n}{n} - \binom{2n}{n+1}$$
is an integer.
